Tucson fully agreed with Talon.  He was feeling the effects even in vehicle=
 mode.  Once transformed he could feel that it would be extremely difficult=
 to transform back into robot mode.  He decided that going back to robot mo=
de would be better, because there was a great chance that Lamia's venom had=
 effected his transformation card.

With an even greater effort, he slowly =
gets back into robot mode, barely able to make the last phase of the transf=
ormation.

"Slag.  That - wasn't a good idea.  If - I remained in my alt fo=
rm there - wouldn't have been any way to - access the correct circuitry for=
 the - repairs."

There was no doubt about it, Lamia's venom was affecting =
him. Yet, he didn't want to seem too helpless either.  He finds the strengt=
h to get on his knees and pauses there for a moment.  At this time his proc=
essor was spinning a million miles per second, as a wave of dizziness hits =
him with enough of a punch to knock him back down on his left side.  He cat=
ches his fall.  

"Better - stand back Talon.  I - don't want to fall on to=
p of you."  

He gets back on his knees and this time, plants his left foot=
 firmly on the ground, and manages to hoist himself back up on two feet, ye=
t using the wall to lean on to keep himself upright.  By hell and high wate=
r he was going to walk on that ramp on his own two feet.

oogroups.com, <airly2002@...> wrote:

> Tucson could not help but smile at Talon's complement. Even=
 though his damages caused him slight pain, he did not want to come across =
as a bot with a low tolerance. The more he sat there, the more he began to =
get in touch with his sociable side. He could sense where Talon was, and is=
 sure to put a gentile hand on her shoulder.
> 
> " Well, if it hadn't been=
 for Kup's training, I don't think I'd be as skilled as I am. I sure do mis=
s him. I can't remember much about what really happened and how I got separ=
ated from the other Autobots. I know I was hit, and I got severely damaged =
by an unexpected blow to my processor.. I wish I could remember where that =
blast came from and who it was from." 
> 
> He tries to get up but weakness=
 takes its toll on him.
> 
> "Ughhh, yeah, that hit definitely took a lot o=
ut of me. Tell Lord Perseus that I'm going to need a little road side assis=
tance. Let's see. I - think it's best that I try to transform, that way, it=
's easier to wheel me out of here. 
> 
> Slowly he manages to transform int=
o his vehicle mode and barely makes it as several metal plates shift with a=
 bit of a lag.
> 
> " That's - better. Kup - warned me there'd be - days li=
ke this."
>
